snippet: Two rarely performed works by Gustav Holst — “Savitri,” drawn from the Sanskrit epic, the Mahabharata, and “The Wandering Scholar,” which takes place in the Middle Ages — were staged by the Little Opera Theater of New York at 59E59...
lead_paragraph: Two rarely performed works by Gustav Holst — “Savitri,” drawn from the Sanskrit epic, the Mahabharata, and “The Wandering Scholar,” which takes place in the Middle Ages — were staged by the Little Opera Theater of New York at 59E59 Theaters.

headline.seo: An Evening of Holst by the Little Opera Theater of New York
